HeadersGetSetCookie.summary: The getSetCookie() method of the interface returns an array containing the values of all {{httpheader("Set-Cookie")}} headers associated with a response. This allows objects to handle having multiple Set-Cookie headers, which wasn't possible prior to its implementation.

remarks.para: This method is intended for use on server environments (for example Node.js). Browsers block frontend JavaScript code from accessing the Set-Cookie header, as required by the Fetch spec, which defines Set-Cookie as a forbidden response-header name that must be filtered out from any response exposed to frontend code.

HeadersGetSetCookie.returns: An array of strings representing the values of all the different Set-Cookie headers associated with a response.If no Set-Cookie headers are set, the method will return an empty array ([ ]).
